text: Standard correlation heatmaps symmetric, displaying identical information triangles. comparing two groups, gg_splitcorr() uses redundancy displaying one group’s correlations upper triangle group’s lower triangle. function requires data frame numeric variables binary splitting variable. computes pairwise correlations group, adjusts p-values multiple testing within , labels statistically significant correlations values. title: Getting Started with ggrecipes
text: frequently encountered task assessing ranking set samples changes across two conditions. gg_rankshift() creates three-panel visualization: side panels display ranked distributions condition, center panel connects corresponding samples lines colored rank change direction. function requires data sample identifiers, grouping variable containing exactly two levels, numeric value ranking. Ranks calculated using summary statistics (mean median) controlled stat_summary.   See ?gg_rankshift options customize colors, adjust panel widths, control point display.
code: # Synthetic data - bacterial strain growth rates growth_data <- data.frame(   strain = rep(paste0("Strain", 1:13), each = 6),   condition = rep(c("Control", "Treated"), each = 3, times = 13),   growth_rate = c(     rnorm(39, mean = 0.85, sd = 0.12),  # Control     rnorm(39, mean = 0.45, sd = 0.10)   # Treated   ) )  gg_rankshift(   data = growth_data,   id = "strain",   group = "condition",   value = "growth_rate" ) # Alternative style & minor customizations gg_rankshift(   data = growth_data,   id = "strain",   group = "condition",   value = "growth_rate",   style = "bar",   fill = c("#e41a1c", "#377eb8"),   rank_change_colors = c(     increase = "#1b9e77",     decrease = "#d95f02",     no_change = "#7570b3"   ),   panel_ratio = 0.65,   point_size = 2.5,   line_width = 1,   decreasing = TRUE )

text: gg_criteria() displays samples multiple criteria heatmap. Optional barplots can added show continuous metrics. vertical alignment heatmap barplot panels depends exported figure dimensions, function provides recommended sizes based number candidates criteria.   Criterion values can displayed text labels tiles.  See ?gg_criteria tile customization, border styling, multi-barplot options.

title: Getting Started with ggrecipes
text: Genotype data typically consist biallelic markers SNPs, individual carries two alleles locus. gg_geno() provides specialized visualization data, sharing core design features gg_criteria() adapted diploid genotypes. tile split diagonally represent alleles simultaneously, samples occupying rows genetic markers occupying columns. function accepts data wide format genotype columns identified regular expression pattern. Genotypes must encoded “allele1/allele2” unphased data “allele1|allele2” phased data. function automatically detects phasing based separator visually distinguishes two cases using border colors: black borders indicate phased genotypes, white borders indicate unphased genotypes. top-left triangle displays first allele, bottom-right triangle displays second allele. Like gg_criteria(), function supports horizontal barplots via bar_column display continuous variables alongside genotypes.   See ?gg_geno allele color customization, tile sizing, barplot styling.

text: gg_seq() displays substrings reference sequence, unique sequence shown row aligned position. Useful visualizing peptide mapping coverage, analysis need show parts reference sequence covered shorter sequences. Supports character coloring region highlighting (e.g. tags, binding sites, CDRs).    See ?gg_seq residue coloring, region highlighting, annotation options, wrapping control.

text: sequence variant analysis, common approach displaying substituted positions reduce visual noise (e.g., Jalview’s “Show Differences Reference” option MSA viewers consensus masking). gg_seqdiff() displays positions differ reference, matching positions hidden. substituted characters displayed, making mutations immediately visible. function can also parse Clustal alignment files directly using clustal argument. gg_seqdiff() supports customization options gg_seq(). title: Getting Started with ggrecipes
text: Kinetic binding data assays surface plasmon resonance (SPR) biolayer interferometry (BLI) often summarized association (ka) dissociation (kd) rate constants. gg_kdmap() displays measurements log-log plot kd x-axis ka y-axis.
